lexUnit.name: adoration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of adoring; profound love

sentence.text: As middle age threatens , my adoration for the horse is once more tinged with apprehension .
She had sensed something more than mere adoration in the way he had kissed her and been aware of her body 's response .
Joanna had looked up at him , open adoration in her glowing sapphire eyes .
The editor , a nervous man always conscious that none of his immediate predecessors had lasted more than two years in the job , held his readers ' adoration of royalty as an article of faith .
Jaq sketched a minor adoration of respect .
But the main reason for this choice is my passionate , unwavering adoration of Brian Clough -- wott a man !
Indeed her adoration of him must have been a balm to his feelings of hurt and rejection because his attitude to her had become distinctly warmer of late .

Why should there be so much adoration of Esther Rantzen and so much favouritism extended towards her , and so much envy of and hostility towards the quite blameless , devastatingly lovely and completely inoffensive Selina Scott ? "
The success soon faded , but my adoration lives on .
The evil evil hardcore of scum supporters who caused aggro all over Europe and the UK in the seventies and eighties , under the smokescreen of media adoration .
` I suppose I had a sort of unfettered adoration for her without knowing it .
Rachel moved towards the stairs , trying to ignore Nightingale 's adoration of the detestable Mr Flint .
Mass adoration is a highly addictive drug .
I was more surprised than gratified , for without having really considered it I would have expected unsolicited adoration to annoy Nour , to lead to stone-throwing â€¦
Morrissey also took a swipe , albeit briefly , at fan adoration .
He tensed himself , joyful and afraid , preparing to turn , bow his head and then drop to his knees in proper adoration .
He was a great lad now , though still slight and not above average height for eleven years , but he had not changed towards her in the least and his adoration of Pilade was touching .
We allow our feelings to flow out towards him in adoration , confession , thanksgiving and praise .
Devotees offer alms to monks and release small birds from cages in adoration .
Sun-kings and Moon-queens stood in stately adoration of each other or , in other guises , warred .
Sheila opened her eyes wide and fixed her father with a precisely constructed look of wistful adoration .
When Tom had finished , he found Willie gazing at him with adoration .
She was bursting with adoration .
And Lisa 's heart brimmed over as , with a look of adoration , Alexander responded with the words she never tired of hearing .
Marco gazed at her with pure adoration .
